org.ardenus.list

Class DeletableList<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractList<E>
        • java.util.ArrayList<T>
          • org.ardenus.list.DeletableList<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of object.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<T>, java.util.Collection<T>, java.util.List<T>, java.util.RandomAccess, Deletable

    public class DeletableList<T>
extends java.util.ArrayList<T>
implements Deletable
    Acts like a normal ArrayList except it implements Deletable, which allows it to have the delete() method which will call the delete() method of all objects in the ArrayList that implement Deletable themselves.
    Author:
    Trent "Whirvis" Summerlin
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
